Violation_Type: Failure to comply with procedural notification requirements
Legal_Issue: Whether the Board breached procedural fairness by failing to properly notify Mr. Anwar of his abandonment hearing
Application_Facts: Mr. Anwar missed the PIF deadline but submitted it late; neither he nor his counsel appeared at the abandonment hearing due to claimed lack of notice
Decision_Outcome: Claim declared abandoned by the Board
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the Board's decision
Court_Ruling: Application for judicial review allowed; case remitted for reconsideration by a different panel
Defendant_Behavior: Board proceeded with abandonment hearing without confirmed receipt of notice by claimant or counsel
Grounds_for_Claim: Procedural unfairness due to inadequate notification
Legal_Standard: Opportunity to be heard before declaration of abandonment under RPD Rules 58
Assessment_Factor: Proof of delivery of notice to correct addresses
Applicable_Legislation: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA), section 168; RPD Rules, Rule 58
Procedural_Issue: Lack of verified receipt of notice despite mailing to correct addresses
Review_Standard: Reasonableness, with emphasis on procedural fairness
Evidence_Used: Board's internal records showing notices were sent to correct addresses
Application_Basis: Claimant’s failure to meet deadlines and attend hearing
Evidence_Assessed: Existence of mailing records, absence of proof of receipt
Relief_Sought: Remittal of the case for reconsideration
Governing_Rule: RPD Rules 58 – abandonment only permissible after opportunity to respond unless specific conditions met
Evidentiary_Deficiency: No proof that notices were actually received by claimant or counsel
Harm_Assessment: Potential deprivation of right to a fair hearing in refugee claim process
Cause_Description: Refugee claim was declared abandoned due to missed deadlines and non-attendance at the abandonment hearing
Evidence_Handling: Reliance on internal mailing logs without confirmation of delivery
Evidence_Issues: Lack of direct evidence of receipt of notice
Evidence_Assessment: Insufficient to establish actual notice was given
Decision_Rationale: Sufficient doubt about whether proper notice was received to undermine procedural fairness
Evidentiary_Issues: Absence of proof of receipt despite correct address mailing
